romeo_and_juliet.title: Romeo and Juliet
romeo_and_juliet.author: William Shakespeare
romeo_and_juliet.summary: Two young lovers from feuding families in Verona fall deeply in love at first sight. Their families, the Montagues and Capulets, have been locked in a bitter rivalry for generations. Romeo, a Montague, secretly marries Juliet, a Capulet, with the help of Friar Lawrence. When Romeo kills Juliet's cousin Tybalt in a fight, he is banished. A plan to reunite the lovers goes wrong when Romeo believes Juliet is dead (she has taken a sleeping potion). He poisons himself at her tomb, and when Juliet awakens to find Romeo dead, she kills herself. Their deaths finally end the family feud.

hamlet.title: Hamlet
hamlet.author: William Shakespeare
hamlet.summary: Prince Hamlet of Denmark is visited by his father's ghost, who reveals he was murdered by Hamlet's uncle Claudius, who has since married Hamlet's mother and taken the throne. Hamlet feigns madness while plotting revenge, causing collateral damage to those around him including his love interest Ophelia. His hesitation and philosophical nature delay action until a final bloody confrontation where nearly everyone dies, including Hamlet himself.

odyssey.title: The Odyssey
odyssey.author: Homer
odyssey.summary: After the Trojan War, Greek hero Odysseus spends ten years trying to return home to Ithaca and his wife Penelope. He faces numerous obstacles including the Cyclops Polyphemus, the enchantress Circe, the deadly Sirens, and the wrath of Poseidon. Meanwhile, suitors invade his home trying to marry Penelope and claim his kingdom. Odysseus finally returns disguised as a beggar, proves his identity, and reclaims his family and throne.
odyssey.setting: Mediterranean Sea and islands, Ancient Greece, Mythological era

dracula.title: Dracula
dracula.author: Bram Stoker
dracula.summary: Jonathan Harker, an English solicitor, travels to Transylvania to help Count Dracula purchase property in England. He discovers Dracula is a vampire. Dracula travels to England and begins preying on Lucy Westenra and later Mina Murray. A group led by Professor Van Helsing pursues Dracula back to Transylvania and destroys him just as he reaches his castle.

frankenstein.title: Frankenstein
frankenstein.author: Mary Shelley
frankenstein.summary: Victor Frankenstein, a young scientist, creates a sapient creature in an unorthodox experiment. Horrified by what he has made, Victor abandons the creature, who then seeks revenge for his painful existence. The creature kills Victor's loved ones one by one, leading to a chase across the Arctic where Victor dies and the creature vanishes into the ice.
frankenstein.setting: Geneva, Ingolstadt, the Arctic, Early 19th century

cinderella.title: Cinderella
cinderella.author: Traditional (Perrault version)
cinderella.summary: A kind young woman is mistreated by her stepmother and stepsisters after her father's death. With magical help from her fairy godmother, she attends the royal ball and captures the prince's heart. She must flee at midnight, leaving behind a glass slipper. The prince searches the kingdom and finds her. They marry and live happily ever after.

macbeth.title: Macbeth
macbeth.author: William Shakespeare
macbeth.summary: Scottish general Macbeth receives a prophecy from three witches that he will become King of Scotland. Encouraged by his ambitious wife, he murders King Duncan and takes the throne. Paranoia and guilt lead to more murders. Lady Macbeth descends into madness and dies. Macbeth is killed by Macduff, and order is restored.
